name: Lido Beach Resort

reviews.text: Nothing special, no good entertainment poolside, no music even at Tiki Hut, average or below rooms. Adult pool is a positive. Would not stay there again. Double beds instead of queens in many rooms. We had four people and got double beds.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Lido Beach Resort and we had an awesome time. We had a 1 bedroom/1 bath suite in the South Tower. It was very clean, modern, more than enough room for us and quiet. We wanted a getaway for some quiet time and that's what we found. We had a spectacular view of the gulf/beach from our suite and spent our mornings walking along the beach and evenings enjoying the sunset. Although there was a free shuttle to St Armands Circle we didn't visit there so we have no idea what it has to offer. Just driving by, it seemed to be buzzing with activities, but we're from Orlando and tourist areas are something we avoid on vacation. We highly recommend this resort and we plan to return in the near future.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: The resort was perfect in a lot of ways from the pool and beach to the walk to Armand's Circle. The room was very nice and clean and it helped having the small kitchen . We highly recommend. A good place to eat would be Camp's Fish Market.
reviews.title: Perfect for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked our stay at the Lido Beach Resort two and a half weeks before we went. We booked through Priceline.com as an "express deal," for a lower price than we found anywhere else. We also noted that the hotel is only rated 3 stars and so we had slightly lower expectations. With that in mind, we very much enjoyed our stay. We were in a double bed room on the fourth floor of the older, main building. Our room was older, but very clean. It had a full size refrigerator, a small dishwasher, sink, stove top range, and microwave, as well as a table to eat at. The room service came everyday, between 12 and 2. One afternoon, they had not come by our room and it was close to 2pm, and so we phoned the front desk and they were up there shortly. Besides the normal tidying up, they vacuumed, mopped the floors, restocked our daily free 2 quart sized bottles of water, popcorn, coffee, toiletries and towels. The "hallways" to the rooms were open air, and there were two chairs outside the door of each room in the older building to sit.
reviews.title: Quiet beach resort, Older but Clean

reviews.text: The beach was clean and had plenty of padded chairs, (and the staff would get you some if none were available), but the umbrellas were $15 a day. We purchased an umbrella in the afternoon around 2pm, (in the summer, the sun is out til after 8pm),but it then quickly started raining for the rest of the day starting at 2:30, and so the front desk was kind enough to credit us back the purchase. (We thought that was excellent customer service, as they could have easily said that they did not credit due to weather).
reviews.title: Lido Beach Resort, Sarasota
Too much riff-raff with tattoos, piercings and beer bellys
reviews.text: We checked into the 4 story building. The staircases in public parking garages are nicer than the ones leading to the rooms. Batthrooms are filthy, old, moldy. Rooms are 2 star motel at best. Our kitchen table almost falls apart, Shocking! At the pool the guitarist is playing too loud, impossible to have a normal conversation. Pool crowd has many tattoos and piercings (usually inversly related to intelligence) and is drinking non-stop. Maybe this has to do with the boat races tomorrow which usually attract a honky-tonk crowd, but i doubt. If you want a nice relaxing resort with a crowd with a minimum level of style this is NOT your place. Extremely expensive for what you get. It's a pitty, because the location is fantastic and the staff is very nice and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not trust the rate they quote you over the phone. This place piles on the junk fees. The following is a true accounting of my invoice for one night-
reviews.title: Deceptive billing pratices

reviews.text: Room rate $215.00
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tax on room: $15.05
reviews.title: in desperate need of remodeling...

reviews.text: Occupancy Tax! $10.75
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lido Beach Resort was a nice Anniversary trip to the beach. The facility is right on the beach with plenty of sand and sea. The outdoor bar was basic, but the drinks and the staff were very good ( we understand that a new pool side bar is in the works). There are two pools and were well used by the guests (I think the wedding attendees were from up north).
reviews.title: Pleasant Weekend at the Beach

reviews.text: The building we stayed in was rather dated somewhat like an older Holiday Inn. The room was clean had a kitchenette and table. There is also a high rise section that appeared to be more up to date.
reviews.title: cha-ching!

reviews.text: There was a large wedding going on and we were fortunate to get the last available room when we booked it online. The staff were very professional and helpful. The breakfast was very good and reasonable. The shuttle to St. Armon's Circle was very convenience and ran about every 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Great Location - Convenient to St. Armand's Circle

reviews.text: Overall, we were very pleased and would think of returning again.
reviews.title: Best hotel on Lido!! Love this place.

reviews.text: Its a very nice hotel!! great location! Love the fact that they have complimentary shuttle bus to take you to St.Aramad circle....but thats what you pay for!!! By the time we were done the bill was much more than i expected. Resort fees,taxes on resort fees etc.. This place is over 200$ a night..ouch! Resort fee?? um okay whatever! I've been to a RESORT ,try Sandals Resorts. Now that I dont mind paying. But no spa offer, swanky room service then you can forget a resort fee. All in all - nice place,great location,beautiful beach but the price is outragous!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Been staying and visiting this great Hotel for over 10 years now. Love the Tikki Bar especially the staff who have been friendly and reliable. People even come from other areas of Florida to chill out.
reviews.title: Tikki Bar

reviews.text: My problem is that the Tikki bar is a disgrace. It is falling apart (litteraly) and why those hard working people are still there i've got no idea. The TV's dont work properly and the ceiling fans dont't work at all. Goodness knows what the sales are but why don't the big corporations have a brain. Take Take Take drives customers away. Common sense in business says you must put something back in. Doesn't have be much, just a little consideration for he people that are making your profits. Ocean properties, get a grip!!!
reviews.title: Paying for location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alex
reviews.title: Great rooms and walking distance to St. Armand's circle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Lido Beach & shuttle to Armand Circle so location is great. The staff is helpful & very good.
reviews.title: Went for the tiki bar & left

reviews.text: Room 326 has black mold around tub enclosure & hood fan over hot plate. High humidity probably makes it hard to stay on top of this but it should be dealt with as plaster is crumbling.
reviews.title: Incredibly located family beach resort
Wonderful beach location
reviews.text: The reason to come to the Lido Beach Resort can be summed up in just a couple of words: great location on a beautiful beach. We returned to the LBR for a mini-cation for this very reason. This is what we liked and didn't care for on our most recent stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good
reviews.title: Great trip

reviews.text: *The proximity to a great beach just can't be beat. This is just a fantastic beach location, right next door to lido beach park and a nice stretch to the north of undeveloped beach lands.
reviews.title: Great location and pool...housekeeping :(

reviews.text: *Best sunsets around!
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: *LBR has two pools - a larger one for families and a decent sized pool for adults who like to swim without having to dodge kids splashing around. Win-win in my book. The LBR staff also did a superb job in keeping the pool sparkling CLEAN which is no mean feat, given the usage.
reviews.title: No food or drinks allows poolside unless you buy from bar. No kid juice boxes no kid snacks.

reviews.text: You can't be the location. It's within walking distance of St Armand's Circle. The beach is pristine and beautiful. Three cons- 1) the outdoor bar is disgusting. It stinks and doesn't look like its been cleaned in ages. 2). Service is OK. The Bartender at Lido Grill told everyone that the bar closed at 10. It felt rude. 3). Beware of the term "balcony". We stayed in 428. There are no balconies unless you are ocean front.
reviews.title: Excellent location - needs updating.

reviews.text: Came here for a meeting, and Lido beach is lovely. The hotel supplies beach towels and I treasured my morning swims. We also had a very pleasant conference dinner there. My one caveat is that many rooms do not have windows that open, which could be nice if you want to avoid humidity, but I go to Florida for the tropical air. They moved me, very promptly, and all the service was friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Nice location
Over priced
reviews.text: A very 3 star experience for 400 a night. Drinks at the bar were 16$ each...we went on a cruise the next day and the same drink was 7$ each to put that into perspective. They didn't clean the room until 3 the next day and the bartender at the pool bar was very rude after I hade to ask for another lemonade due to floating things in the first one. Nothing crazy, but unacceptable at 400 a night.
I was a regular at Lido Beach Resort and always recommended to co-workers and friends.
reviews.title: Have written and faxed letters to managements, but not even a phone call back

reviews.text: Can't believe how much the Tiki Bar has deteriorated. Great team of staff all gone. New kids couldnt work the cash register. Disabled kid treated rudely. Stayed there a load of times. Won't be back including our friends from Boston who stay twice a year. Bring back the old days when service came first!
reviews.title: Tony F. What a load of crap. Locals like us not welcome and the pool deck is heavily policed !
Great Vacation!
reviews.text: We have been to this hotel 3 times. Once in 2007, 2010, and this year. 2007 was a great first experience. 2010 was a big disappointment and this year won us back again. The big change was the positive, friendly attitude of the employees. Everyone was quick with a hello and a smile. This is paramount in such a facility and we welcomed the change with open arms. This is the first year we stayed in the older part and if I could, I would always book room 345. It is closer to the beach and has very easy access. Our housekeeper made the room look special every day. The Sunday Brunch was very good, and Levi our waiter and Jim, the carver took great care of us. Daniel at the Tiki Bar was very professional and friendly. To be honest, the front desk has not caught the same friendly attitude as the rest of the hotel, but maybe one day. We booked our room before the free breakfast was being offered. I inquired about it and was told we did not qualify at our rate. I checked the current rate and sure enough, it was higher than what we were paying, but a simple solution would be to offer us the"free" breakfast for the additional price. I know there is no such thing as free, so I would have gladly paid the difference. I worked in the hospitality industry for 10 years. There is always a better way of solving a problem than saying no. Outside of the brunch and lunch at the Tiki Bar we did not eat in any of the restaurants for the simple fact that the menu had not changed since we began staying at LBR. We chose to done on the Circle. All in all, we had a great time and will return next year.

We went to Lido Beach Resort last summer and i definitely will come back some day. The view was amazing, the sunset a most see, the high floor you get, the better accommodations, and views. I can say, this was one of my favorite vacations. The kitchenette makes it so easy when you travel with kids, that you will go forever looking the same in every place. The restaurant on 8th floor.....perfect!! Let's say you don't need to go far away to enjoy a vacation and this hotel is a good example.
reviews.title: beautiful place, good memories

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sarasota is just two hours distance from my home and decided to take a four day getaway to celebrate my husbands birthday. Check in was a breeze, with friendly staff and other vacationers. The room was roomy and very clean. The Lido provides two 1L waters per day, Kuerig coffee maker with a few single serve pods of coffee/tea, a bag of microwave popcorn per nights stay for each room; and beach towels you can get near the pool area. There's also lounge chairs on the beach.
reviews.title: Relaxing Getaway

reviews.text: They also provide a shuttle to take you to and from St. Armand's Circle until about 10pm. So if you're not up for driving this is great. However, if you so happen to be out at the circle after the shuttle stops running, it's a nice stroll back to the Lido.
reviews.title: The little things count...

reviews.text: This is our third time staying at the Lido Beach Resort. We have always enjoyed it and although this specific stay was less than perfect we may still consider visiting in the future. Perhaps it was the weather, maybe new staff or just a combination of both, however, the excellent service we received in our previous stays was not up to par this one time.
reviews.title: Excellent Amenities with a few let downs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early and attempted to check-in at the front desk. We were told the hotel was booked up and that they would put us on the early check in list. The time was 11:30 a.m. and the front desk person suggested we visit the Restaurant for lunch. The restaurant is right in front of the front desk and they had a a sign at the entrance that said "Please Seat Yourself". My husband, son and I walked in and right about when we were to sit down 2 servers acted surprised we walked in and proceeded to usher us out telling us they were closed. We were surprised given the time, the fact that the front desk recommended them and the door was open with a sign to find a place to sit.
reviews.title: Interesting Stay

reviews.text: The next day we decided to eat by the pool at the Tiki Bar. After we placed our order with the server she disappeared without even bringing us our drinks. About 20 minutes later, she showed up providing us both with meals we did not order. Trying to flag her down to explain the situation was hard work in itself. My husband had to get up and chase her in order to explain. She was not apologetic or even concerned. She just said she would call the restaurant. In the meantime, still no drinks! I decided to chase her down and ask for our drinks. She said she would get them to us. Upon delivering our food, about 15 minutes later, she asked us to remind her what we ordered to drink because she couldn't remember our drink order (coke and water).
reviews.title: Beautiful location. Liked the amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not once did she ask how the meal was. At the end, we had to chase her down again to get the bill. Needless to say this job could have been done better and consequently she received NO TIP.
reviews.title: Great beach, just average room

reviews.text: Having said that, allow me to list a few positives:
reviews.title: An oasis on the Gulf Coast

description: Beachfront location on Lido Key, an island in the Gulf of Mexico with easy access to downtown Sarasota. Featuring 222 suites, kitchenettes and deluxe guest rooms. Short stroll from the renowned shops and cafes of St. Armand's Circle. Beachfront pools - one for families and one for adults 18+ - hot tubs and oceanfront Tiki bar. Two restaurants - one on top of the hotel with panoramic views of Sarasota and the ocean - fitness room and 6,000 square feet of flexible meeting space.
